intro: Angelica boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin angelica, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for their aromatic properties and traditional medicinal uses. Angelica boninensis is adapted to coastal environments and thrives in sandy or rocky soils.
